Title.evidence: Comparative Effectiveness of Coronary Revascularization Techniques: A Network Meta-Analysis

Intervention.evidence: The interventions compared were on-pump coronary artery bypass (ONCAB), off-pump coronary artery bypass (OPCAB), OPCAB with proximal anastomotic device (OPCAB-PAD), anaortic OPCAB (anOPCAB), and percutaneous coronary intervention (PCI).

Objective.evidence: This study aimed to compare the effectiveness of five revascularization techniques in reducing early mortality, stroke, complete revascularization, postoperative atrial fibrillation (POAF), and renal failure.

Result_Outcome.evidence: Compared to ONCAB, early mortality was significantly lower with anOPCAB (OR: 0.57, 95% CI: 0.44–0.73), OPCAB-PAD (OR: 0.61, 95% CI: 0.40–0.92), and OPCAB (OR: 0.64, 95% CI: 0.47–0.87).
